comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: I'm confused why this is labeled "anti-labor", since the signs seem to be pro-labor. Search for "Margaret Hinchey" only turns up articles about woman's suffrage, not the union debate. Anyone know anything more? Thanks

comment.author: 8368002@N03
comment._content: I think this photo was taken in 1914: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Margaret_Hinchey.Laundry.png

comment.author: 10771167@N00
comment._content: It's possibly labeled "anti-labor" because of the signs reading, "We condemn child labor."  Anyone could get confused. :-)

comment.author: 7918966@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called American English, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 11818429@N05
comment._content:
It's clearly a PRO organized labor group!  
One of the signs says, "Do you want clean factories?  Organize!

LOC, this photo really needs to be re-labeled.  Please.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: MARGARET HINCHEY TELLS OF WILSON; President Listened to Working-women's Delegation with Bowed Head. "YES, I KNOW," HE SAID Laundry Worker Makes Effective Speech Before the Equal Franchise League. New York Times; February 5, 1914, Thursday Margaret Hinchey, the laundry worker who was one of the speakers in the delegation of women that went to Washington and interviewed President Wilson last Monday, talked before the Equal Suffrage League at the Hotel Astor yesterday afternoon. She told something of "Why the Laundry Workers Need the Ballot," and more about the visit to the President. Source: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C0DE4D71F3BE633A...

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks all, for your comments on this photo. The caption to a similar photo in the Bain collection: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3a29963 (also in wikimedia commons) notes that it depicts Margaret Hinchey, who was the head of the Laundry Workers Union of New York and a suffrage activist. We will update the photo information when we reload the database.

comment._content: How very Irish. Your photo is very inspiring. I would be delighted if you would join us. I would be honored if you would add this fantastic image to: Proud Irish American
